item.title: Whitney add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The person, be it gentleman or lady, who has not pleasure in a good novel, must be intolerably stupid." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Whitney add a quote by Wallace Stevens
item.description: "Death is the mother of beauty. Only the perishable can be beautiful, which is why we are unmoved by artificial flowers." -- Wallace Stevens

item.title: Whitney add a quote by Sue Monk Kidd
item.description: "Stories have to be told or they die, and when they die, we can't remember who we are or why we're here." -- Sue Monk Kidd

item.title: Whitney add a quote by Sue Monk Kidd
item.description: "some things don't matter much. Like the color of a house. How big is that in the overall scheme of life? But lifting a person's heart--now, that matters. The whole problem with people is...they know what matters, but they don't choose it...The hardest thing on earth is choosing what matters." -- Sue Monk Kidd

item.title: Whitney add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "I find television very educating. Every time somebody turns on the set, I go into the other room and read a book." -- Groucho Marx
